Apparatus.Commentary:
VrS27.2a ima haōmiia] add. ima staōmaiia 2010 (supra secunda manu), 4220; ima staomiia 2220, 2400, 2620 (supra prima manu), 2630, 4200, 4210, 4240, 4280, 4515. Proper of the Indian recitation: ms. 2010 was sent to India, hence the addition.
VrS27.2c ima asma paōiriia dāmąn] difficult to undestand. asma masc. acc. du. analogic from nt.? (cf. dāma). Bartholomae asma as acc. pl. (?). PT ēn āsmān ī fradom dām suggests asma as "sky", but VrS27.2 presents the instruments to be used during the Hōmāst. Maybe "two stones" (?).
